review: No remote.  Must use your tablet, smart phone, etc...  That's OK unless you have four people in your family.  Each person needs to have the Chromecast app on there phone, plus Netflix or other streaming app.  if they want to watch a movie.  One remote with our Wii system works better.  The movie choices are projected on the TV screen with the Wii.  The Netflix movie choices with the Chromecast is on your phone and makes it difficult to read or see.  There are very limited installation and operation instructions with the Chromecast, even if you go to the Chromecast website.  No phone number for technical support.  This is not for non-tech savvy people!!! I also found that sometimes I have to turn off the TV to reset the casting icon on my iPhone and TV.  Iam returning this item and will try the Fire TV Stick, which has a remote.  I recommend looking at the technical comparisons of the Fire TV Stick, Chromecast, and ROKU stick.  It seems that the Fire TV Stick has much more to offer.
